subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to test console output?
msgSnippet: ... That is the next step: if you have many special cases, then you probably have an evolving test fixture. In that case, move them into a new TestCase class
messageBody:
>So said Kris Henderson on 2003-07-31 --------------------
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
>> Sent: Friday, August 01, 2003 5:27 PM
>> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>> Subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test console output?
>>
>>
>> If you have multiple cases for a given method, I recommend
>> starting by naming the methods this way:
>>
>> testMethodName_SpecialCase()
>
>If you have more than 2 or 3 of these would it make sense to put them
>all into their own TestSuite?

That is the next step: if you have many special cases, then you probably have an evolving test fixture. In that case, move them into a new TestCase class and simplify the names.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
